org.miniauth.common

Class IncomingRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.miniauth.common.RequestBase
      • org.miniauth.common.IncomingRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    OAuthIncomingRequest

    public abstract class IncomingRequest
extends RequestBase
    Provider side request, which is sent by a client. Note that IncomingRequest does not represent a full request. It's just a partial wrapper for attributes that are needed for auth handling. [ The "life cycle" of IncomingRequest ] IncomingRequest goes through a similar life cycle as OutgoingRequest. However, its requirement is not as strict as that of OutgoingRequest. It starts with an "init" or constructed state. Once necessary attributes have been added, the object can be declared as being "ready". If the request is in a ready state, then it can be made "verified". Even after setVerified() is called, however, its internal attributes can be modified, in which case, the verified flag is set back to false.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • prepare

        public abstract IncomingRequest prepare()
                                 throws MiniAuthException
        Put this request object in a "ready" state. The request object can be verified only if it's in a ready state.
        Returns:
        this object.
        Throws:
        MiniAuthException - if preparation fails, or the object cannot be put into the "ready" state.

      • verify

        public IncomingRequest verify()
                       throws MiniAuthException
        Put this request object in a "verified" state. (It does not actually "verify" anything.) This is the second of the two "state changing" operations. This can be called only if the current state == ready.
        Returns:
        this object.
        Throws:
        MiniAuthException - if the IncomingRequest cannot be put into the "verified" state.

      • isReady

        public boolean isReady()
        Returns true if the request is in a state where it can be verified.
        Specified by:
        isReady in class RequestBase
        Returns:
        true if it is ready for verification.

      • isVerified

        public boolean isVerified()
        Returns true if this request has been verified. (e.g., if its oauth_signature param has been verified in the case of OAuth, etc.).
        Returns:
        the "verification" state of this request.

      • setVerified

        public void setVerified(boolean verified)

      • isEndorsed

        public abstract boolean isEndorsed()
                            throws MiniAuthException
        Returns true if this request has been "endorsed" (e.g., if it includes the oauth_signature param in the case of OAuth, etc.). Endorsed==true does not mean it's verified.
        Returns:
        the "endorsement" state of this request.
        Throws:
        MiniAuthException - TODO
